meanings_and_examples.definition: The digit or figure 1.
meanings_and_examples.example: In the sequence of numbers, the number one is positioned first.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The neutral element with respect to multiplication in a ring.
meanings_and_examples.example: Consider the set of integers under addition and multiplication (denoted as Z). The number 1 acts as the 'one' because for any integer x in Z, multiplying it by 1 yields x itself: 1 * x = x.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A one-dollar bill.
meanings_and_examples.example: He handed the cashier a crisp new one dollar bill to pay for his coffee.

meanings_and_examples.definition: One run scored by hitting the ball and running between the wickets; a single.
meanings_and_examples.example: In the cricket match, John hit the ball and ran quickly between the wickets, scoring a crucial one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A joke or amusing anecdote.
meanings_and_examples.example: He told a funny one about his mischievous cat that had everyone in stitches.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A particularly special or compatible person or thing.
meanings_and_examples.example: I knew as soon I met him that John was the one for me and we were married within a month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (leet) Used instead of ! to amplify an exclamation, parodying unskilled typists who forget to press the shift key while typing exclamation points, thus typing "1".
meanings_and_examples.example: 2003 September 26, "DEAL WITH IT!!!!11one!!", in alt.games.video.nintendo.gamecube, Usenet

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause to become one; to gather into a single whole; to unite.
meanings_and_examples.example: The team leader worked tirelessly to 'one' the diverse group of individuals, bringing them together and uniting their efforts towards achieving a common goal.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Of a period of time, being particular.
meanings_and_examples.example: One day the prince set forth to kill the dragon that had brought terror to his father’s kingdom for centuries.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being a single, unspecified thing; a; any.
meanings_and_examples.example: My aunt used to say, "One day is just like the other."

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sole, only.
meanings_and_examples.example: He is the one man who can help you.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Whole, entire.
meanings_and_examples.example: Body and soul are not separate; they are one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In agreement.
meanings_and_examples.example: We are one on the importance of learning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The same.
meanings_and_examples.example: The two types look very different, but are one species.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being a preeminent example.
meanings_and_examples.example: He is one hell of a guy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Being an unknown person with the specified name; see also "a certain".
meanings_and_examples.example: The town records from 1843 showed the overnight incarceration of one “A. Lincoln”.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The number represented by the Arabic numeral 1; the numerical value equal to that cardinal number.
meanings_and_examples.example: In many cultures, a baby turns one year old a year after its birth.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The first positive number in the set of natural numbers.
meanings_and_examples.example: In mathematics, when we start counting from 1, 'one' is considered as the first positive integer or the first positive whole number.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The cardinality of the smallest nonempty set.
meanings_and_examples.example: In mathematics, when we say there is only 'one' solution to a given equation, it implies that the set of solutions has a cardinality of one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The ordinality of an element which has no predecessor, usually called first or number one.
meanings_and_examples.example: In a race with only three participants, the runner who crosses the finish line first is considered 'one'.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (impersonal pronoun, indefinite) One thing (among a group of others); one member of a group.
meanings_and_examples.example: Any one of the boys.  The big one looks good.  I want the green one.  A good driver is one who drives carefully.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (impersonal pronoun, sometimes with "the") The first mentioned of two things or people, as opposed to the other.
meanings_and_examples.example: She offered him an apple and an orange; he took one and left the other.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (indefinite personal pronoun) Any person (applying to people in general).
meanings_and_examples.example: One’s guilt may trouble one, but it is best not to let oneself be troubled by things which cannot be changed.  One shouldn’t be too quick to judge.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (pronoun) Any person, entity or thing.
meanings_and_examples.example: "driver", noun: one who drives.
